   [junit4]    > 	at org.apache.solr.parser.SolrQueryParserBase.parse(SolrQueryParserBase.java:151)
   [junit4]    > 	... 64 more

comments.author: Scott Stults
comments.content:
Would it be okay to hardcode a limit on the number of ids to delete (less than 1024) or should we stick in something like
h.getCore().getSolrConfig().booleanQueryMaxClauseCount?

comments.author: Scott Stults
comments.content:
This patch checks to make sure delete requests don't exceed max boolean clauses.

During the test we randomly add more documents and randomly delete some. So it's possible for the number of IDs in the model to grow beyond max booleans, and it's also possible for us to coincidentally ask for 99% of them to be deleted.
